channel.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
channel.description:
Depending on who you talk to you, ghosts create cold spots from drawing energy around then, as a source of power...
Problem is, that to do that, it would take an increadible amount of energy to gather that much energy in the first place...
Thoughts?

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Note-anator:

I agree.

I was watching one program regarding ghosts, and there were 5 people walking through an “Old” house, where supposed ghosts kick back and enjoy a bud - Or whatever else they do. One of the women was given a hand held thermal imager that was accurate to within 1/10,000 of degree. So, there she is walking about in the basement, and all of a sudden, she starts having kittens. “A ghost! A ghost. Oh My God… - blah blah blah”

I just about peed myself laughing… she was walking towards a window.

DOEH!

As for the virtual photon, it is a theory that suggests that matter CAN and DOES escape a black hole, and this is one of the contenders as to how. I am not up on this, but perhaps someone else is. Apperently, Hawkings has changed his opinion on matter being able to escape the event horizon - Shrugs.

XD

I did read a book in which Hawkings discussed matter being able to escape a black hole. I think it’s something like there is a reaction between a particle and an anti particle on the event horizon, one particle escapes, and the other is sucked in, and for some reason that means matter has escaped the black hole, I didn’t fully understand it.

Read full topic
item.source: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
I agree.

I was watching one program regarding ghosts, and there were 5 people walking through an “Old” house, where supposed ghosts kick back and enjoy a bud - Or whatever else they do. One of the women was given a hand held thermal imager that was accurate to within 1/10,000 of degree. So, there she is walking about in the basement, and all of a sudden, she starts having kittens. “A ghost! A ghost. Oh My God… - blah blah blah”

I just about peed myself laughing… she was walking towards a window.

DOEH!

As for the virtual photon, it is a theory that suggests that matter CAN and DOES escape a black hole, and this is one of the contenders as to how. I am not up on this, but perhaps someone else is. Apperently, Hawkings has changed his opinion on matter being able to escape the event horizon - Shrugs.

A virtual photon being, that when a photon is sucked into a black hole, at the threshold of the event horizon (The point of no return) there is a copy of the photon created, (Energy pulled from within the black hole ( I think that is how it goes) and it escapes, having “Taken” a minute amount of energy from the black hole.

One problem with this is why are black holes so dark then? With energy escaping them, one would think they would be brighter… Maybe it is an anit-photon? Don’t know.

As for the negative ion thing, it has been apperently shown, that there are naturally occuring negative ion fields here and there. When a person is exposed to them, it can create a state of a being able to see things that are not there. - I would like to see follow up data to this.

Meanwhile, it may well be time to join the ghost and have a beer.

Read full topic
item.source: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Note-anator:

There is an interesting dicusion that is making the rounds in the Philosophy camp concerning people leaving behind a “Quantum Hologram” after they die. Now how someone came up with this, or how someone would prove it, is beyond my scope to comment - However, it is an interesting concept. An imprint of our physical person, in the qualtum feild. An imprint as it were - somthing like a Virtual Photon on the event horizon of a black hole I suppse, but again, I am guessing at this point.

Personally, I think ghosts are more like a trick of the mind, brought on by subjeciton to a higher than average negative ion field, but then… that is just a guess. (Bad chilli maybe?)

Shrugs

I’m sorry, but hardly anything you say makes sense, it seems like smart sounding bullshit. Perhaps it’s not bullshit, it’s just too smart sounding to understand.

But anyway, rather than a “higher than average negative ion field” I think ghosts come from the fact that people are imaginative, they like to believe in crazy unexplainable things, and when they are in a dark scary house they get scared shitless and start seeing things. The supposed temperature drops that come from the presence of a ghost are simply feeling chilled do to fear. If you held out a thermometer during one of these temperature drops I diubt very much it would change. Or perhaps there really are temperature drops. Perhaps a draft makes the person feel cold and thee second they feel cold they piss their pants and start seeing ghosts. It just depends on which is the cause and which is the effect.

Read full topic

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
Well, the problem is that many of the arguments for God, can be applied to both camps.

“God has always been”

“The universe (Not the way we know it now) has always been”

“God must have created, or there would be nothing”

“Who created God then?”

Round and round it goes. - There are theistic evolutioninst (Actually, a fair number of them - as well as agnostics, if any thing at all)

There is an interesting dicusion that is making the rounds in the Philosophy camp concerning people leaving behind a “Quantum Hologram” after they die. Now how someone came up with this, or how someone would prove it, is beyond my scope to comment - However, it is an interesting concept. An imprint of our physical person, in the qualtum feild. An imprint as it were - somthing like a Virtual Photon on the event horizon of a black hole I suppse, but again, I am guessing at this point.

Personally, I think ghosts are more like a trick of the mind, brought on by subjeciton to a higher than average negative ion field, but then… that is just a guess. (Bad chilli maybe?)

Shrugs

Mettemuse… Really? WOW. Umm… so why would one not think that being as these Ghosts are able to traverse through physical mediums, that they would simply not float away? Hahahaha… Thanks for the LOLs

Read full topic

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
TWO vials, which the owner claims contain the spirits of ghosts exorcised from a house in New Zealand, have been put up for sale on online auction site, TradeMe.

So far, bidding on “Two Captured Ghosts” had reached $NZ410 ($A316), and incited hundreds of comments, with advice ranging from how to get rid of the spirits for good, to the ethics of selling someone else’s captured immortal essence.

https://www.heraldsun.com.au/lifestyle/the-other-side/trademe-lists-two-bottled-ghosts-for-sale/story-e6frfhk6-1225836859720

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: Note-anator
item.description:
Maxey:

:facepalm:

Maybe she needed the modeling job to pay for her studies? For studies that maybe make her a goddamn nuclear scientist? If I work at a McD to pay my college loans does that make me stupid?

That’s for you to answer.

As for her, she may well be intelligent - She may well be.

Shrugs.

I am merely saying that women who dress trashy, usually are not that interested in using their smarts to get by. I certainly have met some VERY brilliant, and beautiful women. None of them would harlot their bodies to take the easy road - for them, dressing like a trashy chick was insulting. They wanted to be known for their brains, not their boobs.

Garth… I really do appreciate the perspective and sense that you inject into conversations.

item.title: Does entropy rule out there being ghosts?
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Note-anator:

If she is so smart, then why in hell choose a shirt that does not even fit her properly? Social intelligence is every bit as (and in some cases, more so) important as intellect. She poses for a camera, flashes her chest, and gets paid.

“So, what do you do for a living?”

(Response) “Oh, I flash my body for cash to males who objectify chicks.”

Yeah… A lot of smarts there… Bwahahahaha

The part I laugh at, are the dill weeds that get all ga ga over a chick, simply because she flashes some skin. What happens? Buddy gets all revved without a second thought as to who the person is that is living in that skin. No smarts required.

Sure, beautiful women can be highly intelligent. I have been lucky enough to have known a few… But I have yet to see a chick dress like a trollop - who uses her body for power - that is actually intelligent. (As in really able to use her brain, not just try and gain power over the simple)

I was wondering who was going to bite.

I dunno, let’s turn the thought… can average, or even not so beautiful women be sexy?

:facepalm:

Maybe she needed the modeling job to pay for her studies? For studies that maybe make her a goddamn nuclear scientist? If I work at a McD to pay my college loans does that make me stupid?

Read full topic
